entries.meaning: Of ecclesiastical property: placed under the control or management of a layperson.

verbs.description: impropriate (third-person singular simple present impropriates, present participle impropriating, simple past and past participle impropriated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To appropriate for private use.
examples: And for the Pardon of the rest, that had stood against the King; the King, upon a second advice, thought it not fit it should pass by Parliament, the better (being matter of Grace) to impropriate the Thanks to himself  [â€¦]

entries.meaning: (transitive) In ecclesiastical law, to place (ecclesiastical property) under control or management of a layperson.
